newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea says one more N.Korean infiltrator killed.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea says one more N.Korean infiltrator killed.

text.p: South Korean troops killed another North Korean infiltrator on Saturday, bringing to 21 the number of Pyongyang agents who have been shot dead since they came ashore from a submarine last week, the defence ministry said.
"He was killled during a gunfight with South Korean troops," a defence ministry spokesman said. Later, a ministry official said the dead infiltrator was wearing a South Korean military uniform.
The infiltrator was one of five still thought to be on the run after the submarine foundered on an east cost reef on Wednesday last week.
Earlier, South Korean foreign minister Gong Ro-myung told the U.N. General Assembly that communist North Korea could be planning more commando-style infiltration raids.
North Korea's U.N. ambassador immediately countered by saying Pyongyang's patience was running out and it reserved the right to retaliate if the submarine was not returned.
